page.title: 09Kingston Grange Farm:1
page.content: The farm has been in the White family since 1938.The farm covers 192 acres but the proposed M40 motorway will cut off 22 of them.The farm has 19 fields and has not grown since the White family moved in. Mr. White has a few hens like Rhode Island Reds.He has twelve cattle which he buys at one week old and keeps for about 2 years.However, the farm is mostly arable and Mr. White grows winter wheat, oilseed rape and peas.He has tried other crops like linseed and barley, but he changes them according to the financial return. The machinery he uses includes ploughs, discs, scuffles, subsoilers, Cambridge rolls and a combined harvester. Mr. White has only one man to help him work the farm which is a typical
